name: 2022 Volkswagen Golf GTI
description:
Overview

The Golf GTI epitomizes the idea of a hot hatch with snappy handling that makes twisting roads fun. A redesign this year improves power and refinement, making it one of the best all-around hatchbacks on the road. The Volkswagen Golf GTI is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the 2.0T SE DSG, which starts at $36,525 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and Front Wheel Drive. This Golf GTI is estimated to deliver 25 MPG in the city and 34 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Spirited acceleration
Responsive handling
Good cargo space

Cons

Tight rear seats
No all-wheel drive

Overall Assessment

The Volkswagen Golf GTI is a performance hatchback that targets driving enthusiasts. It delivers strong acceleration and handling that's as engaging on the morning commute as on winding back roads. It has an attractive interior with quality details throughout. The top Autobahn trim delivers a true premium experience. Despite this little hatch's compact dimensions, it has a good amount of cargo room, making it a versatile choice. Although there's seating for five, the rear seats aren't particularly spacious; adult passengers won't be happy there for long.

Competitors include the Subaru WRX, a sporty hatchback with standard all-wheel drive so it's plenty capable when winter weather arrives. The Hyundai Veloster delivers more power than the GTI at a lower price across its lineup. The Honda Civic is available as a sedan or a hatchback that includes the performance-focused Type R, which boasts impressive horsepower.

name: 2022 Audi A3
description:
Overview

The 2022 Audi A3 is one of the most appealing small luxury cars on the market. It delivers a winning combination of good looks and impressive driving manners. The Audi A3 is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the Premium quattro, which starts at $37,895 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This A3 is estimated to deliver 28 MPG in the city and 36 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Sophisticated design
Excellent ride-handling combination
Impressive powertrain

Cons

Limited trunk space
Many safety features are optional

Overall Assessment

First offered as a hatchback, the Audi A3 switched its emphasis to the sedan body style with the 2015 redesign. And the all-new 2022 version is being sold in the U.S. only in sedan form. For 2022, a turbocharged four-cylinder engine is the standard (and only) powerplant, now with mild-hybrid technology for added efficiency. The interior has a completely new look highlighted by the Audi Digital Cockpit, which puts maps and other information right in the driver's face. The infotainment screen is larger, too. Front seats are exceptionally comfortable yet supportive for spirited driving, and three adults fit comfortably in the rear. In all, the A3 has a near-perfect interior.

The Audi A3 is a couple of inches longer than its most direct competitor, the Mercedes-Benz A-Class. Other sedans that deliver similar vibes include the Alfa Romeo Guilia and Cadillac CT4.

name: 2022 Volkswagen Passat
description:
Overview

A classic family sedan, the Volkswagen Passat offers a spacious cabin, a smooth ride, and plenty of room in the trunk. Although some elements of the cabin design make it feel a bit dated, it's still a capable sedan worth considering. The Volkswagen Passat is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the 2.0T Limited Edition, which starts at $31,570 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and Front Wheel Drive. This Passat is estimated to deliver 24 MPG in the city and 36 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Spacious rear seat
Easy-to-operate infotainment system
Sizable trunk

Cons

Comparable cars have higher-end interiors
Only one engine choice

Overall Assessment

With SUVs dominating the family fleet, the audience for large sedans is secondary. But two strong motivations for sedan ownership are affordability and improved handling. For five decades, the Volkswagen Passat has been a strong seller due to German engineering and design aesthetics. However, popular Japanese manufacturers Honda and Toyota have always dominated the segment. Now the time has come for Volkswagen to retire its largest passenger car; 2022 will be the last model year for the Passat.

Buyers can choose from either a Passat SE base model, the sporty Passat R-Line, or the newly packaged 2022 Passat Limited Edition â€” of which only 1,973 units are being made. That number is based on the year production at the Chattanooga, Tennessee, VW plant began.

name: 2022 Volkswagen Jetta
description:
Overview

The Volkswagen Jetta sedan delivers good bang for the buck for buyers looking for a fuel-efficient, fun-to-drive European driving experience. The Volkswagen Jetta is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 5 trim levels. The most popular style is the SE Automatic, which starts at $25,190 and comes with a 1.5L I4 Turbo engine and Front Wheel Drive. This Jetta is estimated to deliver 29 MPG in the city and 40 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Affordable driving fun
Roomy cabin and trunk
New base 1
5-liter is peppier, more fuel-efficient

Cons

Plain styling
Some low-quality interior trim bits
Not all driver-assist features available on lower trim levels

Overall Assessment

Although Volkswagen is rapidly expanding its roster of crossover SUVs, it isn't moving entirely away from compact cars. The Jetta has been the German automaker's best-selling sedan for quite some time, and a mild refresh this year keeps it relevant.

While the Jetta's boxy styling is no match for the eyeball-turning design of the Hyundai Elantra, its durable interior and front-wheel-drive layout make it a popular choice. It doesn't match the Mazda3's premium cabin and all-wheel-drive traction, and even with its new, thriftier 1.5-liter engine the Jetta is less fuel-efficient than the Toyota Corolla Hybrid. But the VW offers a European driving experience in an affordable small sedan.

The top-of-the-line 228-hp Jetta GLI continues to be a standout among compact performance sedans such as the Honda Civic Si, Hyundai Elantra N Line, and Subaru WRX.

name: 2022 Volkswagen Arteon
description:
Overview

A sleek and spacious sedan, the Volkswagen Arteon straddles the line between practicality and luxury. If you want a car that looks expensive and don't need the performance of a true luxury sedan, the Arteon is a satisfying choice. The Volkswagen Arteon is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the SEL R-Line 4MOTION, which starts at $46,845 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This Arteon is estimated to deliver 22 MPG in the city and 30 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Coupe styling with sedan practicality
Surprising amount of passenger room
Available all-wheel drive

Cons

Cabin doesn't look as impressive as the exterior
Not particularly fun to drive
Overall Assessment
The flagship of Volkswagen's sedan lineup, the Arteon is a gracefully styled four-door that looks more like a low-slung coupe. Don't let the looks deceive you, however, as the Arteon is a surprisingly spacious car that comfortably accommodates four adults. It has a hatchback design instead of trunk, so there's plenty of easily accessible cargo space. Like most Volkswagen sedans, the Arteon has a refined, sporty feel thanks to a firm suspension and precise steering. It's no sport sedan, but it's not a cushy cruiser either. The 2022 Arteon gets a new 300-horsepower engine and seven-speed automatic transmission. Front-wheel drive is standard, and all-wheel drive is optional. The interior is well built and attractive, but the materials are not quite up to luxury-brand standards. The touchscreen interface is small compared to rivals' larger, easy-to-read displays. There aren't many direct competitors in this category anymore, but the Acura TLX is worth a look, as well as the Genesis G70.

name: 2022 Mercedes-Benz C-Class
description:
Overview

Redesigned for 2022, the Mercedes-Benz C-Class compact luxury sedan delivers a true European driving experience. The Mercedes-Benz C-Class is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the C 300 Sedan 4MATIC, which starts at $46,600 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This C-Class is estimated to deliver 23 MPG in the city and 33 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Attractive exterior design
Luxurious interior
Impressive fuel efficiency

Cons

Only the sedan model is updated for 2022
Active safety features cost extra
Overall Assessment
The all-new 2022 Mercedes-Benz C-Class sedan combines classic Mercedes styling with a design that emphasizes the car's timeless proportions. M-B designers have not bowed to the creased-and-folded craze that has taken hold at some other luxury manufacturers. Though a compact, the C-Class offers good accommodations for up to five adult passengers. Ride quality is a pleasant balance of comfort and handling. The C-Class' turbocharged mild-hybrid engine has virtually the same output as the competitive BMW 330i. It offers more horsepower than the base engine in the Audi A4 and the Cadillac CT4. Among this set, all but the A4 are rear-wheel-drive vehicles with optional all-wheel drive. The C-Class still offers coupe and convertible models, but they are carried over from last year, so they don't yet have the updated styling and features of the sedan.

name: 2022 Audi A6 allroad
description:
Overview

The Audi A6 Allroad is an SUV alternative that combines luxury and style in a package with moderate off-road capability. But price and features make it only an average choice against tough competition. The Audi A6 allroad is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 2 trim levels. The most popular style is the Prestige, which starts at $73,495 and comes with a 3.0L V6 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This A6 allroad is estimated to deliver 21 MPG in the city and 28 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Strong V6 power
Attractive, high-class cabin
Sure-footed and stable in all driving conditions

Cons

Competitors offer more cargo space
Questionable value given price, features, and capability

Overall Assessment

Like the smaller Audi A4 Allroad wagon, the Audi A6 Allroad wants to convert the SUV faithful. Riding on a slightly raised suspension with additional height available from the adaptive air suspension, the A6 Allroad can tackle moderate dirt and trail routes when not doing double duty as a family shuttle. While certainly a prime pick for outdoorsy lifestyles, the Allroad is probably better thought of as a sure-footed all-weather wagon, ideal for driving confidently in snowy and wet climates.

For buyers who blanch at the idea of piloting an SUV, crossover, or even, oof, a minivan, the A6 Allroad makes a compelling choice. It offers all the goodness of Audi's A6 midsize luxury sedan, then adds length and a whole lot of cargo space. The ride is quiet, smooth, and absorbent. The Allroad is not as playful behind the wheel as its smaller A4 Allroad sibling, and that's a bit of a disappointment. But none of its rivals are particularly engaging either. You'll forget all that though when you slide into the optional massaging front seats, cue up route guidance from the sharp nav system, and set the cabin lights to a purple hue.

Only a few other buff luxury wagons are available in the U.S., including the Volvo V90 Cross Country and Mercedes-Benz E450 All-Terrain. And while the Subaru Outback doesn't match the European trio's hotel lobby interiors, it is the undisputed leader in legitimate off-road ability and massive cargo space.

name: 2022 BMW 4 Series
description:
Overview

Newly redesigned last year, the BMW 4 Series continues to offer the kind of performance, handling, and comfort that's expected from luxury performance vehicles in this price range. The BMW 4 Series is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 2 trim levels. The most popular style is the M440i Coupe RWD, which starts at $57,695 and comes with a 3.0L I6 Turbo engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This 4 Series is estimated to deliver 25 MPG in the city and 34 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Exceptional all-around performance
Wide variety of configurations to suit any taste
Luxurious cabin with high-quality materials throughout

Cons

Cramped backseat in the coupe and convertible
Blinding interior brightwork

Overall Assessment

Coupes used to be all the rage. Now only a few thousand deals cross the salesman's desk every year. Already susceptible to hot-then-not fashion fatigue, the BMW 4 Series sells half (or less) the volume of the BMW 3 Series sedan upon which it is based. But there is something cool about the cleaner lines of a coupe â€” or convertible in this case.

Competing against the clinical Audi A5, stylish Mercedes-Benz C-Class Coupe, swoopy Lexus RC, and slinky Infiniti Q60, the 4 Series has its work cut out for it. But as the most recently redesigned of the bunch, it has an advantage.

BMW has also reintroduced the 4 Series "Gran Coupe" to the lineup, a four-door hatchback sedan with a sloping roofline (read: less headroom for the second-row occupants). Body style aside, every 4 Series offers swift acceleration, powerful brakes, and a supple suspension that makes for an enjoyable ride no matter the route.

name: 2022 BMW 2 Series
description:
Overview

An all-new design for the BMW 2 Series coupe gives it a more distinctive look while improving its impressive performance credentials. The carryover 2 Series Gran Coupe four-door remains an acquired taste with its awkward styling. Neither bodystyle provides much room for rear passengers. The BMW 2 Series is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 4 trim levels. The most popular style is the 228i Gran Coupe xDrive, which starts at $38,695 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This 2 Series is estimated to deliver 23 MPG in the city and 33 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Quick acceleration
Premium interior feel
Fuel-efficient engines

Cons

Small back seat
Two-door model is no longer offered as a convertible
Overall Assessment
The BMW 2 Series lineup consists of two distinctly different vehicles: the two-door coupe, which is all-new for 2022, and the four-door Gran Coupe which carries forward unchanged from 2021. Both bodystyles are BMW's entry-level models with starting prices in the mid-$30K range. The 2 Series is far from entry-entry level when it comes to performance. The Gran Coupe is the less-powerful sibling, yet even its base 228i model is quick to accelerate and nimble around town. The newly redesigned 2 Series coupe is more powerful and agile than before, so it delivers the feel of a sports car in a handsome package with rear seats that can be used in a pinch. The Gran Coupe has four doors and slightly more room in back, but it too, is tight for rear passengers. All 2 Series models feature premium interiors and solid build quality. The technology interface is an easy-to-use dash-mounted touchscreen. A digital instrument panel is optional along with a head-up display. Most of the design and materials are pulled from the more-expensive BMW 3 Series lineup, so the 2 Series doesn't display any obvious signs of cost cutting. Direct competitors include the Audi A3 and Mercedes-Benz A-Class which have similar price points but are limited to sedan bodystyles only.

name: 2022 Audi A6
description:
Overview

The Audi A6 is an impressive luxury sedan with a stylish interior and a refined ride. It's also well-equipped with the latest technology, but those seeking an engaging, sporty feel will be disappointed. The Audi A6 is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the Prestige 3.0, which starts at $70,595 and comes with a 3.0L V6 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This A6 is estimated to deliver 21 MPG in the city and 30 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Attractive cabin details
Powerful engines
Five-star safety rating

Cons

Anonymous design
Small trunk

Overall Assessment

Audi offers an extensive lineup of high-end luxury sedans. The Audi A6 is the Goldilocks of the pack, slotting between the brand's compact Audi A4 and flagship Audi A8 sedans. With a choice of robust powertrains and standard all-wheel drive, the Audi A6 feels capable and in control. The car delivers good fuel economy, too, but it doesn't have the sporty edge of some of its competitors. One area where the A6 does shine is the cabin, where quality materials make it look and feel expensive. Audi's standard equipment also provides a big helping of modern electronics.

Unfortunately, shoppers have plenty of options in the midsize luxury sedan segment. If you are looking for a more affordable choice, the Lexus ES 350 starts at $41,000 and includes a more powerful engine than the A6, with many of the same features. The Genesis G80 2.5 starts at $48,745, gets better gas mileage, and delivers more horsepower than the A6. The BMW 5 Series is priced similarly to the Audi and delivers engaging performance.

name: 2022 Audi S6
description:
Overview

The turbocharged Audi S6 is a sophisticated and exciting midsize sport sedan with enough power and performance to embarrass many sports cars. The Audi S6 is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 2 trim levels. The most popular style is the Prestige, which starts at $82,595 and comes with a 2.9L V6 S/C and Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This S6 is estimated to deliver 18 MPG in the city and 28 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Serious performance
Snazzy high-tech cabin
Smart, understated styling

Cons

Complex touchscreen ergonomics
Performance isn't as potent as in some rivals
Overall Assessment
One of our favorites in the luxury sport sedan segment, the Audi S6 is an extremely well-rounded package that combines top-shelf refinement and features with thrilling power and performance. Based on the beloved Audi A6, the S6 provides a modern high-tech cabin, with a state-of-the-art infotainment system and high-end materials, including leather upholstery and wood trim. But the sedan's showpiece is its performance, courtesy of its twin-turbo V6 engine churning out 444 horsepower, its adaptive air suspension, and its standard all-wheel-drive system. Rivals include the 429-hp Mercedes AMG E53 and the significantly more powerful 523-hp BMW M550i.

name: 2022 Audi A4
description:
Overview

The well-rounded Audi A4 is an engaging sport sedan that delivers real performance and luxury with standard all-wheel drive and impressive safety technology. The Audi A4 is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 6 trim levels. The most popular style is the Premium Plus 40 TFSI quattro, which starts at $45,695 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This A4 is estimated to deliver 26 MPG in the city and 34 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Good power and acceleration
Standard all-wheel drive
Smooth ride and athletic handling

Cons

Conservative exterior design
Not as much horsepower as some rivals
Overall Assessment
The A4 is one of Audi's most popular models, and it's one of its most affordable sedans. Larger than the Audi A3, the A4 sits in the heart of the sport luxury sedan category, which also includes the BMW 3 Series, the Mercedes-Benz C-Class, and the Lexus IS. Despite its heady competition, the A4 stands out with standard all-wheel drive, impressive performance, and a luxurious cabin. The turbocharged A4 is quick and fun to drive with tight steering and a well-tuned suspension. It's also packed with tech features. The A4's exterior design is conservative compared to its rivals, but it's undeniably handsome. In a class where over-styling and gaping oversized grilles have taken a foothold, the A4 brings an understated elegance to the segment. Inside, the A4 is comfortable, attractive, and well-put-together.

name: 2022 Audi A5
description:
Overview

Three stunning shapes â€” coupe, convertible, and hatchback â€” combined with sharp handling and advanced tech make the Audi A5 one of today's best compact sports cars. The Audi A5 is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the S line Premium Plus Sportback 45 TFSI, which starts at $51,995 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This A5 is estimated to deliver 24 MPG in the city and 31 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Sporty handling and performance, boosted by standard all-wheel drive
Premium interior materials
Three body styles to suit most lifestyles

Cons

Some competitors offer more rear passenger room
Scant cargo space in coupe and convertible models
Hefty premium for optional safety features

Overall Assessment

With high-riding SUVs all the rage these days, Audi is one of the few automakers still in the coupe and convertible game. The 2022 Audi A5 blends the brand's trademarks â€” style, all-wheel-drive handling, technology â€” into stunning coupe, convertible, and four-door "coupe" shapes. Impeccable cabin design and materials infuse the interior with a luxury feel. Tech and infotainment are rich and full-featured, and while power is modest, the way the A5 slices through turns is joyous.

For 2022, the A5 adds a handful of upgrades. Android Auto, like Apple CarPlay, is now wireless, freeing the center console of cable spaghetti. A now-standard sport suspension sharpens handling for the coupe and Sportback hatch models. The popular Black Optic Plus appearance package is now available for the base Sportback.

Audi isn't the only brand still bullish on coupes and convertibles, of course. Safe to say that if rivals such as BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Lexus were not also still invested in two-doors and droptops, Audi's boardroom discussions might find renewed focus. But for now, the A5 remains one of the most refreshing alternatives to boxy sedans, sleepy SUVs, and Jeep-y safari cars.

name: 2022 Audi S4
description:
Overview

The Audi S4 emphasizes performance without losing sight of comfort, and it has an opulent cabin. However, rival models have the edge in horsepower. The Audi S4 is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the Prestige, which starts at $61,295 and comes with a 3.0L V6 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This S4 is estimated to deliver 21 MPG in the city and 30 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Exhilarating acceleration
Sporty yet comfortable
Swank cabin

Cons

Not much room for storage in the cabin
Less horsepower than key rivals

Overall Assessment

The Audi A4 is a compact luxury car beloved for its suave refinement. The S4 is this car's high-performance variant; it adds visceral thrills courtesy of a more muscular powertrain and an upgraded sport suspension. There are different sides to this sedan. It's high-energy when thrill-seeking is on the itinerary, but it's peaceful and calm when you've got more mundane pursuits at hand.

On the downside, the S4 isn't the most potent pick in its class. Rivals such as the BMW M3 and Alfa Romeo Giulia Quadrifoglio have more horsepower. But those comparisons aren't likely to be top of mind when you're behind the wheel of Audi's poised, polished contender.

name: 2022 BMW 3 Series
description:
Overview

If you had to buy one car that could do it all, the BMW 3 Series would be an excellent choice. It delivers high levels of performance, refinement, and efficiency in a stylish package. The BMW 3 Series is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the 330i xDrive, which starts at $44,445 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This 3 Series is estimated to deliver 25 MPG in the city and 34 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Refined and athletic chassis
Great engines
Surprisingly fuel-efficient

Cons

Interior lacks pizzazz
Some competitors offer better value
Overall Assessment
The BMW 3 Series, now in its seventh generation, has long been the sport sedan standard-bearer. Since its last redesign (for 2019), it has delivered on that reputation in spades, offering not only a delightfully engaging driving experience with best-in-class engines and spirited handling but also adding high levels of refinement and comfort. It used to be that you bought a Mercedes-Benz C-Class for luxury, an Audi A4 for technology, and a BMW 3 Series for performance. But now the 3 Series does it all quite well, though performance is still its strongest suit. With prices ranging from the low-$40,000s for a base 330i to more than $60,000 for a loaded M340i, the 3 Series is certainly not cheap. Newcomers like the all-electric Tesla Model 3 and the Genesis G70 challenge the 3 Series in terms of performance and value. But the 3 Series still provides the complete package: a fun, efficient, and comfortable sedan that's more than the sum of its parts.

name: 2022 BMW i4
description:
Overview

BMW's latest EV looks like a classic small sport sedan â€” a nice change from the slab-nosed aerodynamic styling exercises of many electric cars. A tech-intensive interior and incredible performance make it a standout in its price range. The BMW i4 is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 2 trim levels. The most popular style is the eDrive40, which starts at $56,395 and comes with an Electric engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This i4 is estimated to deliver 109 MPGe in the city and 108 MPGe on the highway.


Pros

Impressive range and performance
Looks like a normal sport sedan
Outstanding infotainment interface and display

Cons

Lacks features that should come standard for the price (heated seats)
Price escalates quickly with a few options and packages

Overall Assessment

Exciting, innovative, and a window to the future, today's electric vehicle revolution is a wonderful moment in time. But, real talk now: It's turning out some ugly cars. Sure, style is subjective, but one of the most appealing traits of the 2022 BMW i4 is its shocking normalcy compared to its hyper-styled peers.

But for the badges and a few aerodynamic bits, the i4 looks like the sleek four-door BMW 4 Series Gran Coupe. It even shares the same basic dimensions. Finely tuned suspension and steering settings, plus a low center of gravity, give the i4 the sporty and agile handling for which BMW is known. But with 335 horsepower in the base trim and up to 536 hp in the high-performance M50, the i4 vaults over its gas-powered counterparts in speed, performance, and instant, low-end power.

With 227 to 300 miles of driving range (depending on trim), the i4 has a wide range of competitors, from the Audi e-tron and Polestar 2 to the Ford Mustang Mach-E and Kia EV6. And it outdistances its primary rival, the Tesla Model 3 Standard Range Plus. The i4 offers less cargo space than most EVs, but it packs more punch and performance, and its infotainment interface sets a new standard. With its understated style and over-caffeinated performance, the i4 provides a refreshing take on the electric future.

name: 2022 Audi A4 allroad
description:
Overview

Combining luxury, style, and sportiness in a rugged, off-road package, the Audi A4 Allroad is a compelling alternative for buyers who want utility without the bulk or height of an SUV. The Audi A4 allroad is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the Premium Plus, which starts at $50,795 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This A4 allroad is estimated to deliver 24 MPG in the city and 30 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Attractive style, inside and out
Engaging handling on dry roads, confidence-inspiring when wet
Sophisticated infotainment and technology features

Cons

Many of today's more common driver aids don't come standard
Decent cargo and passenger space, but some competitors offer more

Overall Assessment

It's telling that in order for Audi to interest Americans in its wagon models, the automaker offers just a few choices, two of which it disguises as SUVs. One is the Audi A6 Allroad, the other the smaller Audi A4 Allroad. The Allroad rides on a slightly raised suspension, with more ground clearance than a regular sedan, protected by impact-resistant body cladding that gives it the visual heft of an off-roader with the style of a European sport wagon.

Such are the illusions necessary to attract attention in a country bewitched by crossovers, trucks, and SUVs. But for buyers who blanch at the idea of forcing their lifestyles and families into an SUV or minivan, the A4 Allroad makes a compelling alternative. With its low stance, the A4 Allroad drives like a longer version of its Audi A4 sedan sibling, with confident, stable handling and a smooth ride.

Only a few other rugged wagons still roam U.S. highways, including the Volvo V60 Cross Country and the Subaru Outback (/subaru/outback/). The Volvo takes cabin luxury to another level, while the Subaru offers more cargo and passenger space. Still, the Audi straddles the worlds of dirt and asphalt like few others.

name: 2022 Mercedes-Benz CLA
description:
Overview

The Mercedes CLA measures up to the luxury brand's reputation with sharp design, strong performance, and a comfortable, upscale interior that's packed with tech features. The Mercedes-Benz CLA is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the CLA 250 4MATIC, which starts at $41,250 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This CLA is estimated to deliver 24 MPG in the city and 33 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Cool coupe-like exterior
Four-door practicality
Two available high-performance AMG versions

Cons

Complicated infotainment system
Tight rear seat
Not as fuel-efficient as some rivals
Overall Assessment
The Mercedes-Benz CLA may be one of the luxury brand's smallest and most affordable sedans, but it is every inch a Mercedes, with distinctive design, an impeccable interior, robust build quality, and world-class engineering. This is one of the best-looking small sedans on the planet, with a cool coupe-like silhouette and a sporty low and wide stance. Mercedes even calls the CLA a coupe, so don't confuse it with the Mercedes-Benz A-Class sedan, which is smaller, less powerful, and costs about $4,000 less. With a strong 221-horsepower turbocharged engine and well-tuned suspension, the CLA 250 delivers abundant driving pleasure, and the high-performance Mercedes-AMG variants, the CLA 35 and CLA 45, take a decidedly sporting turn. Some may find the CLA's infotainment system to be unnecessarily complex and its rear seat too snug, but overall, it competes very favorably with the two available variants of the BMW 2 Series Gran Coupe as well as the Audi A3, Audi S3, and Audi RS 3.

name: 2022 Mercedes-Benz CLS
description:
Overview

The Mercedes-Benz CLS merges coupe styling with the practicality of a four-door car, although rear-seat passengers might question how well it blends the two. An ultra-smooth engine and elegant cabin give it a true luxury feel. The Mercedes-Benz CLS is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 1 trim levels. The most popular style is the CLS 450 Coupe 4MATIC, which starts at $74,000 and comes with a 3.0L I6 S/C and Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This CLS is estimated to deliver 22 MPG in the city and 30 MPG on the highway.


Pros

Powerful and smooth standard engine
Opulent cabin
Easy-to-use infotainment system

Cons

Sleek styling results in a tight backseat
Small trunk for a sedan of its size
Overall Assessment
The Mercedes-Benz CLS is a luxury sedan with a turbocharged engine and opulent interior. It accelerates quickly and handles smoothly, keeping its composure around corners. Inside, the CLS provides seating for five people. Passengers in the rear may feel cramped due to the car's sloping roofline, but those upfront get plenty of head- and legroom. The CLS comes with many technology and safety features, and it offers plenty of optional equipment as well. Starting at $74,000, the Mercedes-Benz CLS is actually one of the more affordable options in its class. Its closest competitor, the BMW 8 Series, is priced at $86,000. Another alternative to the CLS is the Audi A7 priced from $70,000.

name: 2022 Mercedes-Benz EQS
description:
Overview

The all-new 516-horsepower Mercedes EQS electric sedan impresses with a limousine-like cabin in a modern, aerodynamic five-seat package that provides up to 350 miles of electric driving range. The Mercedes-Benz EQS is a 5-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the EQS 450+ RWD, which starts at $103,360 and comes with an Electric engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This EQS is estimated to deliver 97 MPGe in the city and 97 MPGe on the highway.


Pros

Roomy, hushed, luxurious interior
Exhilarating acceleration with 516-hp EQS 580 model
Available door-to-door Hyperscreen

Cons

Less driving range than Lucid Air or Tesla Model S
Hyperscreen reflections distracting in bright sunlight

Overall Assessment

The 2022 Mercedes-Benz EQS is the first to wear the Mercedes-EQ badge. By leading the electric charge with an S-Class-worthy luxury five-seater, the long-running German automaker is showing just how serious it is about electrifying its products in the coming years.

The 2022 EQS has a presence that won't be ignored, from the aerodynamic shape and long wheelbase to the radically different cab-forward profile, hidden hatchback, and extra-large rear seat. The 329-horsepower EQS 450+ is a first-rate premium electric sedan, but the EQS 580 with 516 zippy horsepower, added 4matic all-wheel drive, and best of all, the 56-inch-wide Hyperscreen dash display is the one that you just have to experience. The battery-electric EQS sedan brings true luxury and craftsmanship as well as leading-edge technology to the premium EV space.
